__data__.text:
www.lawcommission.gov.np  
1 
 Passport  Act, 2019  (2076 ) 
Date of Authentication  
14 October , 2019  (2076.6.27 ) 
 
Act Number 11 of the Year 2019  (2077)  
An Act made to amend and consolidate  laws regarding p assports  
Preamble : Whereas, it is expedient to amend and  consolidate  prevailing laws in order to regulate 
and manage the matters regarding  passports including  issuance of  passport , travel document  to 
the Nepal i Citizens who in tend to visit foreign countries;  
 
Now, therefore, the Federal Parliament enacts  this Act.  
 
Chapter -1 
Preliminary  
1.  Short Title and Commencement : (1) This Act may be called "Passport Act,  2019  (2077 )". 
(2) This Act shall come into force immediately.  
 
2.  Definition : Unless the subject or the context otherwise requires, in this Act: - 
(a) "Prescribed" or "A s prescribed" means the prescribed or as 
prescribed pursuant to the Rules framed under this Act or in an order 
issued by the Government of Nepal by a notification  published  in 
the Nepal Gazette.  
(b) "Mission" means Nepal embassy, permanent mission,  Nepali 
consulate general, consulate, special mission  located  in any foreign 
country and also includes any office established in foreign country 
by the Government of Nepal to operate diplomatic business .

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
2 
 (c) "Ministry" means the Ministry of Foreign Affairs , Government of 
Nepal.  
(d) " Travel  Document " means a travel document  to be issued pursuant 
to Section 17.  
(e) "Passport" means  a machine readable, electronic or biometric 
passport to be provided by the Government of Nepal to the Nepali 
citizen intending to visit abroad.  
(f) "Department" means Department of Passport s. 
(g) "Travel in course of government business " means travel for 
prescribed  business  pursuant to a decision of the Federal and 
Provincial Government and subordinated bodies, local level, 
Federal Parliament, Provincial Assembly and Constitutional Bodies 
and also the travel on formal invitation of the foreign government, 
semi - governmental and internationally accredited organizations.  
 
Chapter -2 
Regarding Passport  
3.  Passport to be received : (1) A Nepali citizen shall have to travel abroad along with the 
valid term passport.  
  (2) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub -section (1) if there is no need of 
passport to a Nepali citizen to travel to any country pursuant to the treaty, agreement 
concl uded between the Government of Nepal and any foreign State or Government, the 
Nepali citizen may travel to such country without the passport.  
 
4. Issuance of passport : (1) It shall be the power of the Government of Nepal to issue a 
passport.  
(2) The Depart ment shall on behalf of the Government of Nepal , perform the act of 
issuing a passport pursuant to sub -section (1).

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
3 
 (3) The Department shall while issuing a passport issue in accordance with the 
prevailing standards of the International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO).  
 
5. Types of passport : (1) The types of passports to be issued pursuant to Section 4 shall be 
as follows: - 
   (a) Diplomatic Passport,  
   (b) Official  Passport,  
   (c) Service Passport,  
   (d) Ordinary Passport  
  (2)  The term of  period of  the pa ssport to be issued pursuant to sub -section (1) shall 
be as prescribed.  
6. Diplomatic p assport :  The Department shall issue a diplomatic passport to the officials 
travelling abroad in course of government business  or special work, as prescribed, upon a 
decision of or recommendation by the concerned Ministry, Constitutional body or 
Secretariat.  
7. Official  passport : The Department shall issue an official passport to the officials and 
employees travelling abroad in course of government  business , study, study  visit or 
training on nomination from the Government of Nepal, Provincial Government or any 
government body, as prescribed, upon request from the concerned body along with the 
decision thereof.  
8. Service p assport : (1) The Department shall issue  a service passport  to the private assistant 
to the ambassador, permanent representative, special representative, consular general and 
employees of gazetted level and classless employee upon written request from the Ministry.  
  (2) The Department may issue a service passport to a Nepali citizen working as 
local employee in the mission upon written request from the Ministry or the mission.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
4 
 9. Ordinary p assport : (1) The D epartment may issue an ordinary passport to the Nepali 
citizen.  
  (2) O ther provisions related to ordinary passport shall be as prescribed.  
10. To submit  application for passport : (1) The Nepali citizen desiring to have a passport  
shall submit  an application to the Department, mission or the prescribed body in a 
prescribed format enclosing the original o r copy of the Nepali citizenship certificate or the 
original or copy of the national identity card issued by the Government of Nepal and 
documents as prescribed.  
  (2) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub -section (1),  in case of a minor 
Nepali citizen  who is below than  sixteen years of age, any one from among his or her father, 
mother , guardian or curator shall submit an application along with him or her and also 
enclosing the documents as prescribed.  
  (3) The department may issue a passport in the  name of a minor in the following 
condition s even though the application is not submitted by any one from  among his or her 
father, mother, guardian or curator: - 
(a) in case the court issued an order to issue a passport in the name of 
such minor, or  
(b) in other condition s as prescribed.  
(4) If the Department considers fit  to issue a passport upon inquiry made to the 
applications submitted  for the passports pursuant to sub -section (1) or (2), shall issue 
passports by maintaining a record thereto.  
11. Issuance of a  passport : (1) The body to which  the application is submitted for passport 
shall issue the passport maintaining the record thereof.  
  (2) The other provisions related to distribution of passport shall be as prescribed.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
5 
 12. Not to issue a passport or to withhold passport : (1) Notwithstanding anything co ntained 
elsewhere in this Act, a  passport may not be issued or  may be  withheld  in the name of the 
following persons :- 
(a) upon receipt of the writ ten request from the investigating authority  not to  
issue a passport or to withhold a passport in course of the investigation of 
the charge of the offence related to passport, immigration, corruption, 
money laundering, human trafficking, abduction, narcotic drugs, illegal 
transaction of arms and ammunition , organized crime or terrorism,  
(b) upon receipt of an order of the Court not to issue a passport or to withhold 
a passport in the case subjudice in the court in charge of the offence related 
to passport, immigration, corruption, money laundering, human tr afficking, 
abduction, narcotic drugs, illegal transaction of arms and ammunition, 
organized crime or terrorism,  
(c) upon serving a sentence upon conviction from the Court in charge of the 
offence related to passport, immigration, corruption, money launderi ng, 
human trafficking, abduction, narcotic drugs, illegal transaction of arms and 
ammunition, organized crime or terrorism,  
(d) upon enlisted in black list upon default of payment of the loan of the bank 
and financial institution,  
(e) upon restriction on t ravelling abroad or not to issue a passport or to withhold 
a passport issued by an order of the Government of Nepal or of the Court 
with reasonable grounds,  
(f) when a decision has been made as not to issue a passport or withhold 
passport specifying the reasons thereof by the body issuing passport,  
(g)      when valid period of more than one year remains in the passport issued in 
the name of the passport holder.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
6 
 (2) If the Department does not issue an ordinary passport by the reason as specified 
in sub -section (1 ), it shall provide information thereof to the concerned applicant . 
 (3) In case the court orders to issue a passport or not to withhold it under the 
condition of clause (a) of sub -section (1), a passport shall be issued in the name of such a 
person.  
(4) The passport shall be issued in the name of the person if he or she is acquitted 
from the Court for  the offence pursuant to clause (b) of sub -section (1) or if he or she has 
served the sentence in accordance with the law for the offence pursuant to clause (d ). 
(5) A passport may be issued in the name of the person upon receipt of non-
existe nce of the conditions pursuant to clauses (d), (e) or (f) of sub -section (1) in his or her 
regard.  
13. More than one passport  may be issued : Notwithstanding anything co ntained elsewhere 
in this Act, a  new passport ma y, even  though the term of the earlier passport remains valid , 
be issued in the following condition s:- 
(a) in case a diplomatic or official  passport holder submits  an 
application for the ordinary passport,  
(b) in case an ordinary passport holder submits  an application for the 
diplomatic or official  passport in accordance with the prevailing 
laws. 
14. Passport may be issued even though its valid period remains : Notwithstanding 
anything contained in clause (g) of s ub-section (1) of Section 12, a new passport may be 
issued , even though the term of the passport issued in the name of the passport holder 
remains valid for more than one year  in the following conditions :- 
(a) in case the passport is no t readable being old, tampered , withered or 
not being able to use due to error in details  thereof,  
(b) in case no adequate pages left in the passport,

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
7 
 (c) in case of change  of surname,  
(d) in case the passport prepared by the Department gets lost or 
destroyed prior to its dist ribution to the concerned person,  
(e) in case the minor intends to have  a passport before attaining sixteen 
years of age,  
(f) in case the passport has been issued in special circumstance,  
(g) in other conditions as prescribed.  
15. Passport  may be cancelled : (1) The Department may cancel the passport in the following 
conditions: - 
(a) in case the passport holder informs the Department or the mission 
about the lost passport issued in his or her name,  
(b) in case the passport is cancelled or revoked by the orde r of the Court,  
(c) in case the passport holder no longer remain s a Nepali citizen,  
(d) in case  it is proved that the non -Nepali citizen has received the 
passport,  
(e) in case the passport is  received by providing false details,  
(f) in case the applicant does not receive  the passport within the 
prescribed time after submitting the application.  
(2) The Department shall provide information of cancellation of the passport 
pursuant to clauses (a), (b), (c), (d) and (e )  of sub -section (1) to the concerned body of the 
Govern ment of Nepal, foreign missions located in Nepal and office of the Interpol located 
in Nepal.  
(3) If any Nepali citizen submits  an application in the mission for a new passport 
upon lost of his or her passport in the foreign country, the mission shall writ it to the 
Department to cancel such a passport specifying all the details of the passport holder and

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
8 
 the passport number and such information shall also be provided to the Immigration office 
at Nepal,  Ministry responsible for foreign affairs of the country w here the concerned 
mission is locate d and the foreign missions in that country.  
16. To use passport : (1) The provisions on use of diplomatic and official passport s shall be as 
prescribed.  
  (2)  The holder of the diplomatic or official passport shall have to return such 
passport to the Department after the completion of the purpose pursuant to sub -section (1).  
  Provided that the person bearing the prescribed public post may keep the diplomatic 
or spec ial passport with himself or herself up to the term as prescribed.  
 
Chapter -3 
Regarding Travel Document and Seamans Record Book  
17. Travel document : (1)   The Department and mission may issue  a travel document.  
  (2)  The terms and conditions for issuance of  a travel document to be issued 
pursuant to sub -section (1) shall be as prescribed.  
18. Seamans passport: (1) The Department or the mission may issue seamans passport to the 
Nepali citizen who is going to work in ships.  
  (2) If an ordinary passport holder s ubmits  an application for seamans passport to 
the Department or mission enclosing the prescribed documents for the purpose of working 
in ships, the Department or mission shall issue seamans passport subject to the prescribed 
terms . 
 
Chapter -4 
Regarding Pas sport to be Issued in Temporary and Special Condition

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
9 
 19. Temporary passport  may be issued : The Mission may issue a temporary passport to the 
Nepali citizen residing abroad if he or she submits an application for a new passport for 
expiry of the valid term of the passport, lost, destroyed or by the reason of passport not 
being able to use being tempered , for a period not exceeding nine months till the issuance 
of a new passport.  
20. Passport to be issued in special condition : (1) In case  any minor son or daughter of  the  
Nepali citizen resides abroad and has not acquired certificate of Nepali citizenship at taining 
sixteen years of age, submits  an application enclosing prescribed documents along with the 
evide nce that he or she has not acquired foreign citizenship or applied for the certificate of 
foreign citizenship, the mission may issue the ordinary passport in his or her name for a 
period not exceeding  two years term for once.  
  Provided that the mission may issue the ordinary passport for him or her for 
additional two years term if he or she submits an  application specifying the reason for not 
being able to acquire the certificate of Nepali citizenship as a result of force majeur e. 
  (2) Such passport holder shall have to receive the ordinary passport by acquiring 
the certificate of Nepali citizenship w ithin the period  pursuant to sub -section (1) . 
 
Chapter -5 
Regarding Offence and Punishment  
21. Offence : If any one commits, cause to commit or abet the commission of any of the 
following acts shall be considered as commission of an offence pursuant to this Act: - 
(a) receives or attempts to receive a passport or travel document submitting false 
details,  
(b) visits or a ttempts to visit a foreign country without having a passport or travel 
document pursuant to this Act,  
(c) fails to  abide by the order or direction issu ed by the Government of Nepal,

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
10 
 (d) uses the passport for the purpose other than the purpose  for which  it is is sued, 
(e) provide s own passport for the use to other or uses other's passport,  
(f) corrects photo or details in the passport,  
(g) holds in controls other person's passport without his or her consent and with 
malafide intention,  
(h) performs  any other act in contrary to this Act and the Rules framed under this 
Act. 
22. Punishment : (1) Anyone who commits  the offence pursuant to clause (a), (b), (c), (d), 
(e)or (g) of section 21 shall be l iable to the punishment with fine  of  two lakh rupees to five 
lakh rupees or with an imprisonment of one year to three years or with both.  
  (2) Anyone who commits  the offence by committing any act contrary to this Act 
and the Rules framed under this Act other than those referred to  in sub -section (1) shall be 
liable to the punishment with fine of  fifty thousand rupees to one lakh rupees or with 
imprisonment of six months to one year or with both.  
  (3) If anyon e who order s or abets to commit any offence shall be liable to the 
punis hment as an offender referred to  in sub -sections  (1) and (2) and the accomplice  to 
such an offence shall be liable to the half of the punishment imposed to the offender.  
23. No obstruction to take action in accordance with prevailing laws : If any  act to be 
considered as an offence under this Act is also considered as offence under other prevailing 
laws, nothing contained in this Act shall hinder  to take action instituting the case under 
prevailing law s in respect to such an offence.  
 
Chapter -6 
Miscellaneous

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
11 
 24. Colour, Format and Size of Passport:  The colour, format and size of the passport to be 
issued pursuant to Sections 5, 17, 18, 19 and 20 shall be as prescribed.  
25. Fees : (1) No fees shall be imposed to issue diplomatic, official  or service passport.  
  (2) The fees as prescribed, shall be imposed to issue ordinary passport, travel 
document, seamans passport, temporary passport and passport to be issued in special 
conditions.  
26. Passport may be returned : (1)  The ordinary passport holder may return the passp ort 
issued in his or her name to the Department if it is not required by him or her or he or she 
is not in a situation to keep the passport with him or her because of any other reason thereto.  
  (2) The Department shall cancel the passport returned pursuant to sub -section (1).  
27. Electronic Record and Personalization:  (1) The Department shall conduct the act of 
passport personalization by processing the personal details of the applicant certified by the 
concerned body and received with the applicati on for the passport also with the means of 
technology.  
  (2) The Department shall prepare and place securely the electronic record of 
passports, travel documents and seamans passports in a format as prescribed.  
  (3) The details of the travel documents and  seamans passports issued by the mission 
shall be sent to the Department in each three months.  
28. To keep documents safe : (1) The applicati on filed for passport and also  other documents 
enclosed shall be kept safe ly for twelve years from the date of issuanc e of the passport.  
  (2) The Department shall dispose the passports cancelled pursuant to this Act as 
prescribed.  
  (3) The disposal procedure of the documents pursuant to sub -section (1) shall be in 
accordance with the prevailing laws.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
12 
 29. Government to b e Plaintiff : The Government of Nepal shall be a plaintiff in the case of 
offence punishable under this Act and such cases shall be deemed to be included in the 
Schedule -1 of the Nationa l Criminal Procedure Code, 2017  (2074 ). 
30. Appeal:  A person not satisfying with the decision of the Department for rejecting to issue 
the passport or cancel the passport may file an appeal in the High Court of the province 
where the Department is situated within thirty five days of the receipt of informatio n of 
such rejection or cancellation.  
31. Delegation of Power : The Department may delegate some of its power s, obtained by it 
under this Act, to other body or official as required.  
32. Saving of the act done in good faith:  No employee shall be personally liable for the act 
done in good faith under this Act.  
  Provided that the provision of this Section shall not be considered to have  been  
hindered  to take any legal action to the consequence arising from the act done with 
negligence.  
33. Rules  may be framed : The Gover nment of Nepal may frame necessary Rules to 
implement this Act.  
34. Procedure  may be framed : The Ministry may frame necessary Procedure s without 
prejudice to the objective of the Act.  
35. Repeal and Saving : (1) Passport  Act, 1976  (2024 ) has been hereby repealed.  
  (2) The act s performed in accordance with the Passport Act, 1976  (2024 ) shall be 
considered to have been performed in accordance with this Act.
